isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - Before 12/06/1994 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - EXPANSION VALVE

step1.para: Make sure the key switch is off.
Recover the air conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove the access cover from the passenger side of the instrument panel and the Blend-Air unit housing.
Disconnect the wiring harness connector from the blower resistor located on the bottom of the blower housing.
Remove the insulated tape from the expansion valve and evaporator inlet and outlet tubes.
Using two wrenches, disconnect the expansion valve equalizer line from the fitting on the evaporator outlet tube ( Figure 20). Plug or cap the outlet tube.
Remove the screw and clamp securing the expansion valve feeler bulb to the evaporator outlet tube.
Disconnect the expansion valve inlet tube from the expansion valve. Plug or cap the inlet valve.
Remove the bolt, nut and clamp securing the expansion valve to the bracket on the blower housing.
Using two wrenches, disconnect the expansion valve from the evaporator core inlet tube. Remove the expansion valve. Plug or cap the inlet tube.

svcsubproc.title: Install

step1.para: Install a new O-ring, lubricate the threads with MINERAL-BASED refrigerant oil and connect the expansion valve to the evaporator core inlet tube. Using two wrenches, tighten to 25 to 28 ft-lbs. (34 to 38 Nm).
Install the clamp, bolt and nut securing the expansion valve to the bracket on the blower housing.
Install a new O-ring, lubricate the threads with MINERAL-BASED refrigerant oil and connect the expansion valve inlet tube to the expansion valve. Tighten to 13 to 20 ft-lbs. (18 to 27 Nm).
Position the expansion valve feeler bulb on the evaporator core outlet tube and secure with the clamp and screw ( Figure 20).

svcsubproc.para: Install a new O-ring, lubricate the threads with mineral-based refrigerant oil and connect the expansion valve equalizer to the fitting on the evaporator outlet tube ( Figure 23). Using two wrenches, tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 Nm).

step1.para: Wrap the expansion valve and evaporator inlet and outlet tubes with insulating tape.
Connect the wiring harness connector to the blower resistor.
Evacuate and charge the air conditioning system as described in GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Run the engine and check the operation of the system. Check for leaks and repair as necessary.
Install the access covers on the Blend-Air unit housing and the instrument panel.
